intro: Polygala spartioides, commonly known as the desert milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Polygala spartioides plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
